bodyText:

 Create API for creating/saving a temporary token
 Add email template and sending logic
 Add validations and timeouts
 Update the sign in view

title: updated to use alternate to openweathermap api
bodyText:
Pre-Submission Checklist




 Your pull request targets the staging branch of FreeCodeCamp.
 Branch starts with either fix/, feature/, or translate/ (e.g. fix/signin-issue)
 You have only one commit (if not, squash them into one commit).
 All new and existing tests pass the command npm run test-challenges. Use git commit --amend to amend any fixes.

Type of Change


 Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
 Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

It's really just a documentation change.
Checklist:



 Tested changes locally.
 Closes currently open issue: I believe Closes #9145

Description

The Open Weather Map API was not serving over HTTPS, leading to mixed content issues, since geolocation requires HTTPS. Forecast.io's API is also free, requires sign up, but up to 1k hits per day w/ no charge or card on file.
I'm (unsurprisingly) not the first person to notice this. Seems to intersect w/ #7853 and #9145, the latter I believe it closes, at least accounts for it from the documentation side of things (as the currently recommended open weather map API leads to a funny experience, at least for Chrome users).

title: Re-order Margin Tests to Top-Right-Bottom-Left
bodyText:
Pre-Submission Checklist




 Your pull request targets the staging branch of FreeCodeCamp.
 Branch starts with either fix/, feature/, or translate/ (e.g. fix/signin-issue)
 You have only one commit (if not, squash them into one commit).
 All new and existing tests pass the command npm run test-challenges. Use git commit --amend to amend any fixes.

Type of Change


 Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
 Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

Checklist:



 Tested changes locally.
 Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #11111

Description

Challenge: "Add Different Margins to Each Side of an Element"
Change the order tests are run to Top, Right, Bottom, Left.
Previous they were ordered as Top, Left, Right, Bottom.
Why: The Tests, in the order run, form a checklist of the items the student needs to perform in order to pass this challenge.
The order they were listed is not only unnatural, but is not the order they need to memorize and write their code in later.
Reordering the tests to the proper Top, Right, Bottom, Left format prepares them to think, and act in that order and aids in future memorization of the sequence.

title: Fix 'npm run only-once' command on Windows
bodyText:
Pre-Submission Checklist




 Your pull request targets the staging branch of FreeCodeCamp.
 Branch starts with either fix/, feature/, or translate/ (e.g. fix/signin-issue)
 You have only one commit (if not, squash them into one commit).
 All new and existing tests pass the command npm run test-challenges. Use git commit --amend to amend any fixes.

Type of Change


 Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
 Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

Checklist:



 Tested changes locally.
 Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #XXXX

Description

I've started contributing to FreeCodeCamp about a week ago. When I started contributing, I also joined the Contributors chat room. From my own experience and the experience of many other new contributors, I've found there's an issue in the npm run only-once command. \n on Windows doesn't add a new line. In fact, it's even worse. In the script, it seems to break. This pull request removes the new lines. I realize that this does make these little messages harder to catch. I think the trade-off is worth it, though. Because there is no new output for a while after the first message, and the last message is the very last thing logged, they're still hard to miss. I did some research on getting newlines in the command line on Windows, but there doesn't seem to be an easy cross-platform solution.
I hope this will help out new contributors, taking one more bump out of the road of contributing to a large open source project. üî•

title: Fix minor typo in instructional text
bodyText:
Pre-Submission Checklist




 Your pull request targets the staging branch of FreeCodeCamp.
 Branch starts with either fix/, feature/, or translate/ (e.g. fix/signin-issue)
 You have only one commit (if not, squash them into one commit).
 All new and existing tests pass the command npm run test-challenges. Use git commit --amend to amend any fixes.

Type of Change


 Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
 Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

Checklist:



 Tested changes locally.
 Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #XXXX

Description

Changing 'because' to 'and' alters the sense of the sentence "These conditions are known as Boolean conditions because [and] they may only be true or false." "Because" implies that the name boolean inherently implies truthiness or falsiness, which is not the case, and even if it has come to have that association for developers and mathematicians, new programming students with no development or mathematical background would not make that association.

Description

In /client/saga/err-saga.js#7, the dispatched action has type app.makeToast but there is no this type name in the project. I looked into /common/app/redux/types.js which contains all the action types with prefix app, and makeToast is no where to be found. So I use the action creator from /common/app/toasts/redux/actions.js instead.
closes #11198
